I would recommend "Heart of Darkness" and "Welcome to Sarajevo". Both movies are about war, and the characters in both movies face difficult choices and conflicts.
"Heart of Darkness" is a classic novel that was first published in 1897. The story is set in Africa during the period of the Belgian Congo (now Democratic Republic of Congo)). The story follows a British military officer named Marlow who is hired by a wealthy merchant named Kurtz to bring back supplies from the Belgian Congo. During his journey, Marlow encounters various characters, including other members of Marlow's military unit, as well as various local African inhabitants.
"Welcome to Sarajevo" is another classic movie that was first published in 1964. The story is set during the period of the Bosnian war (which lasted from June 1992 until December 2004)). The story follows a British military officer named Michael Henderson who is hired by an American military officer named Flynn to bring back supplies from the Bosnian war. During his journey, Michael Henderson encounters various characters, including other members of Michael Henderson's military unit, as well as various local Bosnian inhabitants.
